result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Documents verified with scanning; Paper file destroyed, retained electronically (scanned).
Def in person & by Atty Gary R. Schmaus.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  Clerk: CP.  Cases called:  14CF271 & 14CF331.  State moves to dismiss and read-in to 14CF271; Court so orders.
Victim does not request to be present for hearings

Def in person & by Atty Gary R. Schmaus.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper appeared for State. Pretrial has taken place, tentative offer received, short adjournment requested; Discussion re: new charges; Counsel doesn't believe there are any new charges pursuant to information rec'd from ADA Cannon; Court reviews information w/ the def; Counsel anticipates resolution.  Hearing scheduled for November 12, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Def in person & by Atty Gary R. Schmaus.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth appeared for State.  Clerk: CP.  New charges are being issued and no offer has been made at this time.  Counsel req adj; global resolution anticipated.  Def waives preliminary hearing.  Court questions def and accepts waiver.  Arraignment scheduled for October 8, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Bond amended from $1500 cash to $500 cash; No contact with any Walmart in Washington County

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Gary R. Schmaus.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State.  Clerk: CP.  Counsel expects resolution and req adj.  Counsel req bond modification.  Court amends bond to $500 cash.  Adj to allow further pretrial and for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for September 10, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
14R 017030  Bond receipted at Clerk of Courts Office
No contact with any Walmart in Washington County

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Gary R. Schmaus.  Atty Mandy Schepper for State.  Clerk: CP.    Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Def has other pending Br 4 case (14CF271).  Court sets $1500 cash bond.  Def waives time limits on preliminary hearing; Court accepts waiver.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for August 25, 2014 at 09:45 am.
